headline: Embattled BP replaces CEO, naming Woodside Energy chief as first-ever woman leader of a Big Oil giant
summary: BP’s new American CEO is a global traveler who just helped an Australian energy player grow worldwide.

headline: BP appoints Woodside Energy’s Meg O’Neill as new CEO
summary: Investing.com -- BP plc has named Meg O’Neill as its new chief executive officer, effective April 1, 2026.

headline: Woodside Energy CEO Succession
summary: PERTH, Australia, December 17, 2025--Woodside CEO and Managing Director, Meg O’Neill, has advised the Board of her resignation and has accepted the role of Chief Executive Officer at bp p.l.c.

raw.headline: Woodside Energy CEO Succession
raw.summary: PERTH, Australia, December 17, 2025--Woodside CEO and Managing Director, Meg O’Neill, has advised the Board of her resignation and has accepted the role of Chief Executive Officer at bp p.l.c.

headline: SBM Offshore signs contract extension of FPSOs Mondo and Saxi Batuque
summary: Amsterdam, December 17, 2025 SBM Offshore announces it has signed a contract extension related to the lease and operation of FPSOs Mondo and Saxi Batuque with Esso Exploration Angola (Block 15) Limited, as the Operator of Block 15, an affiliate of ExxonMobil. The extension secures ownership and operations by SBM Offshore until 2032. The agreement includes life-extension activities, for equipment replacement and refurbishment, to maintain high safety standards and ensure operational excellence th

headline: EIA: Brazil, Guyana, Argentina Driving 2026 Oil Output Growth
summary: Brazil, Guyana, and Argentina are set to be major drivers of non-OPEC oil supply growth in 2026, accounting for half of the expected 0.8 million barrels per day (b/d) increase in 2026 according to the EIA

headline: Exxon Mobil (XOM): Assessing Valuation as Recent Momentum Cools After Solid One-Year Gains
summary: Recent performance and what it might signal Exxon Mobil (XOM) has slipped about 3% over the past month and is roughly flat over the past 3 months, even as its 1 year return sits near 10%, raising fresh questions about valuation and timing. See our latest analysis for Exxon Mobil. With the share price recently easing back to 114.68 dollars and a softer 1 month share price return, the contrast with Exxon Mobil's stronger 1 year total shareholder return suggests momentum is cooling a little as...

headline: Trump’s Venezuela Blockade Lifts Oil. Exxon and Chevron Rise.
summary: Oil prices surged Wednesday, jumping off multiyear lows after President Donald Trump ordered a “total and complete blockade” of oil tankers into and out of Venezuela.

headline: Stock Market News for Dec 17, 2025
summary: U.S. stocks ended mostly lower on Tuesday, with the Nasdaq managing to close in the green, as investors assessed delayed economic data and tried to gauge the Federal Reserve's monetary policy outlook for the near term.
